# Draft:Ashish Tewari

----
Ashish Tewari 'Aarav'
Ashish Tewari, known by his pen name Aarav, is an Indian poet and author from Haldwani, Uttarakhand. He gained recognition for his debut Hindi poetry collection, Mere Khayal, which he published in 2020 during the COVID-19 lockdown.
Early Life and Education
Aarav was born in Haldwani, Uttarakhand. He pursued a Bachelor of Science degree. During his studies, he developed an interest in Hindi literature and poetry.
Career
Aarav worked as an Academic Specialist at Byju’s, an ed-tech company. In 2020, he published his first poetry collection titled Mere Khayal. The book includes a mix of Hindi poems and ghazals. According to media reports, he completed the manuscript during India’s COVID-19 lockdown.
The book attracted attention from local media and readers, especially for its emotional themes and poetic language. He has since participated in poetry recitations and spoken-word events, including digital podcasts and live sessions.
Aarav is also known for his Hindi poetry podcast, where he recites self-composed poems and ghazals.
Bibliography
* Mere Khayal (2020)

Ashish Tewari 'Aarav'
Ashish Tewari, known by his pen name Aarav, is an Indian poet and author from Haldwani, Uttarakhand. He gained recognition for his Hindi poetry collection Mere Khayal, published in 2020 during the COVID-19 lockdown.
Early Life and Education
Aarav was born on 11 February 2001 in Haldwani, Uttarakhand. He pursued a Bachelor of Science degree and worked as an Academic Specialist at Byju's, an educational technology company.
Career
In July 2020, at the age of 19, Aarav published his debut Hindi poetry book, Mere Khayal, through Nitya Publications. The collection includes poetic forms such as ghazals, nazms, and ashaar, showcasing a modern approach to traditional Hindi literature.
During the COVID-19 lockdown, Aarav wrote and compiled his poems, which later became Mere Khayal. The book received regional media attention and was appreciated for its emotional depth and lyrical style.
Aarav has performed at spoken-word venues such as The Social House in Delhi and hosts a podcast, Poetries By Ashish Tewari Aarav, where he recites original Hindi poetry.
Bibliography
